user.speaker: user
user.text: I also tried to update my credit card, but it keeps showing errors

agent.speaker: agent
agent.text: I'm sorry to hear that you're having trouble updating your credit card. Can you please let me know the error you are seeing? It can be like "Could not place order. Problem authorizing the credit card. We are unable to process your request: Transaction Rejected; Could not place order. Problem authorizing the credit card. We're afraid this transaction has been rejected; or Failed to complete the Change Request process due to the following error: We are unable to process your request: Transaction Rejected."

contexts.text:
Credit Card error messages 

An issue might occur when you try to update, add, or remove a credit card. Review the following credit card error messages for detailed self-help information.



 Why was my credit card transaction rejected? 

Protecting your identity is a priority and IBM Cloud takes credit card verification seriously.

 What’s happening 

An issue occurred that caused the transaction to fail. For example, the name and address on file with IBM Cloud doesn't match the information on file with the company that issued your credit card. This error might prompt the following message:

> Error: Could not place order. Problem authorizing the credit card. We are unable to process your request: Transaction Rejected

 Why it’s happening 

Something went wrong when verifying your credit card, and the transaction wasn't successful.

 How to fix it 

To ensure that your credit card verification is successful, complete the following steps:



1. Verify that the name and address for your IBM Cloud account matches the name and address on file with your credit card issuer.
2. Verify that the country associated with a VAT or tax identification number matches the country in your IBM Cloud account. For example, a VAT ID registered in France can't be associated with an IBM Cloud account that is registered in Finland.
3. Verify that you are creating a business account and not a personal account if you are specifying a VAT ID or tax identification number.
4. Review the error message that was displayed. If your transaction was rejected and an email address was not provided, contact your credit card issuer.
5. Contact us by calling 1-866-325-0045 and selecting the third option.







 Why do I get an error when I try to update my credit card? 

You tried to change your payment method by adding a new credit card in the IBM Cloud console [Payments page](https://cloud.ibm.com/billing/payments).

 What’s happening 

After you entered your credit card information and saved it, the following message displayed:

> Failed to complete the Change Request process due to the following error: We are unable to process your request: Transaction Rejected.

 Why it’s happening

Why do I get an error when I try to update my credit card? 

You tried to change your payment method by adding a new credit card in the IBM Cloud console [Payments page](https://cloud.ibm.com/billing/payments).

 What’s happening 

After you entered your credit card information and saved it, the following message displayed:

> Failed to complete the Change Request process due to the following error: We are unable to process your request: Transaction Rejected.

 Why it’s happening 

Something went wrong when verifying your credit card, and the update wasn't successful.

 How to fix it 

Go to the [Support Center](https://cloud.ibm.com/unifiedsupport/supportcenter) and click Create a case.





 Why was there a general decline of my credit card? 

 What’s happening 

You tried to make a payment or place an order in the IBM Cloud console [Payments page](https://cloud.ibm.com/billing/payments), but you get the following error message:

> Could not place order. Problem authorizing the credit card. We're afraid this transaction has been rejected. General decline of the card. No other information provided by the issuing bank.

 Why it’s happening 

Your credit card issuer has declined the transaction.

 How to fix it 

Contact your credit card issuer for more information.





 Why is my credit card inactive or not authorized? 

 What’s happening 

You tried to make a payment or place an order in the IBM Cloud console [Payments page](https://cloud.ibm.com/billing/payments), but you get the following error message:

> Could not place order. Problem authorizing the credit card. We're afraid this transaction has been rejected. Inactive card or card not authorized for card-not-present transactions.

 Why it’s happening 

Some credit card issuers don't allow transactions when it is being initiated by using a credit card on file. You might see this error message if your credit card has been deactivated.

 How to fix it 

Contact your credit card issuer for more information.

ml.tokens.model_text: Why was there a general decline of my credit card?

contexts.text:
Contact the Cloud Trust and Enablement team by email at [verify@us.ibm.com](mailto:verify@us.ibm.com).





 Why was my change request rejected? 

 What’s happening 

You tried to place an order in the IBM Cloud console [Payments page](https://cloud.ibm.com/billing/payments), but you get one of the following error messages:

> Failed to complete the Change Request process due to the following error: We're afraid this transaction has been rejected. Invalid account number.

or

> Failed to complete the Change Request process due to the following error: We are unable to process your request: Transaction Rejected.

 Why it’s happening 

Your credit card number was not recognized by your credit card issuer.

 How to fix it 

Contact your credit card issuer for more information.





 Why was my change request rejected because of a VAT ID? 

 What’s happening 

You tried to complete a change request IBM Cloud console [Payments page](https://cloud.ibm.com/billing/payments), but you get the following error message:

> Failed to complete the Change Request process due to the following error: VAT ID is a required field for ...

 Why it’s happening 

Your VAT ID, CST or other tax identification number cannot be validated.

 How to fix it 



1. Verify that tax identification number is valid.
2. Verify that the tax identification number is associated with the same country as the physical country of residence in your IBM Cloud profile.
3. Verify whether a VAT ID is required to create an IBM Cloud account in your country of residence. For more information, see [Personal use availability](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/account?topic=account-account-getting-startedsignup-personalaccts).
4. Verify that you are creating the correct account type: personal or business.







 Why was there an error in the payment process? 

 What’s happening 

An issue occurred that caused the payment process to fail. This error might prompt the following message:

ml.tokens.model_text: Why was my change request rejected?

contexts.text:
Submit your account upgrade information again. If the error continues to occur, you can contact [IBM Cloud Support](https://cloud.ibm.com/unifiedsupport/supportcenter).





 Why can't I save my credit card to the account? 

 What’s happening 

An issue occurred that caused the payment process to fail. This error might prompt the following message:

> Your card could not be saved. Please try another card.

 Why it’s happening 

Your card information was incorrect.

 How to fix it 

Use a different credit card to process your transaction.





 Why was my credit card declined? 

 What’s happening 

An issue occurred that caused your credit card to decline. This error might prompt the following message:

> Your payment was declined for invoice number…

 Why it’s happening 

You have a credit card on file and it was declined.

 How to fix it 

Update your credit card information on the [Payments page](https://cloud.ibm.com/billing/payments). Credit card transactions are automatically retried within 24 hours after you update the information.

ml.tokens.model_text: Why was my credit card declined?

agent.original_text:
I'm sorry to hear that you're having trouble updating your credit card. The error could be caused by various reasons such as incorrect information, mismatched billing addresses, or issues with your credit card. Here are some steps you can take to troubleshoot the problem:
1. Verify that the name and address for your IBM Cloud account matches the name and address on file with your credit card issuer.
2. Ensure that the credit card information, including the card number, expiration date, and CVV code, is correct.
3. Check if your credit card issuer is experiencing any issues or if there are any restrictions on using the card for online transactions.
4. Try using a different web browser or device to update your credit card information.
5. If the issue persists, you can contact IBM Cloud Support for further assistance by clicking the Help icon in the console menu bar, selecting "Support center," and then clicking "Create a case."
Regarding your question about the subscription code, it's possible that you don't have the required access in the account or the code expired. You must have an Editor role or higher on all account management services to successfully apply a subscription code. If the expired code needs to be reissued, you would need to contact the person who provided the code for help.
Similarly, if you cannot apply a feature code, your account might not meet the requirements for the feature code, or you don't have the required access in the account. The code might also be expired. To successfully apply a feature code, you must have an Editor role or higher on all account management services. If the expired code needs to be reissued, you would need to contact the person who provided the code for help.
